p: The World Health Organization has declared the Coronovirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) “a pandemic”. As per the Institute of Epidemiology Disease Control and Research-Dhaka, with an exponential growth or increasing trend, total 1231 confirmed cases of COVID-19 with 50 deaths have been reported in Bangladesh by 15th April 2020. Being the 12th densely populated country of the world, Bangladesh is at great risk for a collapse of the healthcare system and social life. Like COVID-19, Dengue is an acute viral disease caused by the dengue virus. This Aedes ( Aedes aegypti) mosquito-borne virus often could be fatal for the patients.
